sentence.idiomatic: The rumors about the two of them have been circulating for a long time.
He frequently gets involved in sex scandals with his female co-stars.
Those are all just rumors of love affairs, they're not true.
What they are both speaking of is the same matter.
No money--how did that come about? Please explain clearly.
Oh, so it's that kind of a thing.
How is it that the two of them suddenly so affectionate? They were just arguing.
It's really disgusting to be so intimate in front of so many people.
You are too affectionate with each other; no wonder people misunderstand.
That isn't his voice, it must have been altered.
This is composed of many different kinds of materials.
Do you know how to alter photos?
He got the gold medal again.
As long as you study hard, you can come in first place.
She got the award for best female lead.
He didn't do this, you have wronged him.
It feels really awful to be wrongly accused by a good friend.
If you don't know then don't gossip. What if you wrongly accuse a good person?
I am really useless, I can't help you at all.
When you get here, even if you have money it's of no use.
Is studying really of any use, or not?
Liu Jia, come to my office for a moment.
Sure, Miss Zhao.
There are rumors of the sex scandal between you and the pageant supporter all over the internet. What is this all about?
How could that be? We just had dinner together.
Then how could there be such intimate photos?
They must be altered.
Now the reporters are saying that Zhou Peng is going to help you get the title--that the Blogger's Beauty Pageant is unfair.
I have been wronged. There is nothing between me and Zhou Peng.
Telling me is of no use.
Miss Zhou, you have to believe me.
Sorry, you might be disqualified.
